Hello. Can I apply for a project if I only possess required 'Skills' or should I also be competent enough to implement the project requirements and achieve the expected outcome? I find most of the skills required already being possessed or can be acquired within the time available before the internship period, but not knowledgeable on how to specifically apply those skills to achieve the expected outcome. Can I still apply? Will I be guided for the same, during the internship?

@sebtowin As a general rule I've found it's always best to apply even if I don't have all the skills and to let the interviewers decide if I'm qualified rather than eliminating myself from the selection pool early. With that said, I think you should definitely apply.

@aniketsingh03 We're no longer accepting internship project proposals from the community. We're accepting applications from interested students to apply to the 17 projects. Details on how to apply can be found here: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/INTERN/How+to+Apply
Has joined the channel.
Thanks @myu, btw is there any word limit on the cover letter?
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/internship-program?msg=nasFPWiCMpRJKkMyt) @myu
@aniketsingh03 No specific requirement on word limit on cover letter. But I would recommend to conform to the regular length of a cover letter, like 1-2 pages.
And do we need to mention about all the 4 projects ? @myu

@TheAlgo I think if you could address how your experience and background would be applicable to the projects you're applying for in cover letter that would be great. I recommend that you really dig into the details of the project, select and focus your cover letter on 2. Of course, you do have the option to apply up to 4, if you wish. Also, in your cover letter, we really want to see that you're an applicant who is passionate about becoming an active contributor  in the Hyperledger open source community through this internship experience.

For my project, my mentors has been contacting through mails. It would be easier if we can use a private channel. I asked on the general channel, there  people are saying that's not possible.
Do we need to have to slack or some other alternative?

@harsh-98 I recognized the same problem, the need for collaboration channel for a small group around a single project. To address this need I created a child wiki page of the project for collaboration https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/INTERN/Collaboration%3A+Raspberry+Pi+Indy+Agent.  The page I created will most likely become documentation. Yours could include questions that anyone in the group can answer where you directly message others as needed.
This Rocket Chat instance supports discussions. They are public ad-hoc channels on a specific topic. We are using one for our collaboration.
https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/issues/13843

Hi everyone! I'm working on Sawtooth Explorer. I'm implementing the feature of configurable decoding: I already have protos uploading and configuring the rules to choose which message to apply -- I tested it with Sawtooth Marketplace -- and currently was trying to test other decoding options, but the Sawtooth XO validator doesn't seem to listen on tcp://localhost:4040, it doesn't respond to subscription requests from my explorer's backend. Marketplace's validator does. localhost:8008/state works nice, xo create/take from shell container works too.
```vlad@Xiaomi:~$ sudo netstat -ntlp | grep LISTEN
...
tcp6       0      0 :::4004                 :::*                    LISTEN      13585/docker-proxy
...```
Can anybody suggest something?

Hi everyone! I'm working on Sawtooth Explorer. I'm implementing the feature of configurable transactions payload and state elements decoding: I already have protos uploading and configuring the rules to choose which message to apply -- I tested it with Sawtooth Marketplace -- and currently was trying to test other decoding options, but the Sawtooth XO validator doesn't seem to listen on tcp://localhost:4040, it doesn't respond to subscription requests from my explorer's backend. Marketplace's validator does. localhost:8008/state works nice, xo create/take from shell container works too.
```vlad@Xiaomi:~$ sudo netstat -ntlp | grep LISTEN
...
tcp6       0      0 :::4004                 :::*                    LISTEN      13585/docker-proxy
...```
Can anybody suggest something?
@bormisov It's best to ask in the Sawtooth specific channel.

I was really want to work under "Build a university course on Hyperledger Fabric using Hyperledger Umbra" and so few days back I started looking for the designing of the courses and all I have done some work on it. 
So basically we can divide the whole project into some important parts to design the course which are as follows
1. Course Designing
2. Writing Syllabus
3. Delivering the content 
And inside these 3 designing parameters we will add some educational elements to easy building the project

Course Designing
1. Principles
2. Who are the Students
3. Constraints in course
4. Objective of studies
5. Assessment and its different types  
6. Instruction strategies
7. Course content and Schedule

 Writing Syllabus
1. Writing Syllabus for the new course
2. Revise the new syllabus
3. Continuously Improving the syllabus

Writing Syllabus
4. Objectives
5. Deliverables of the course


Delivering the content 
1. Instructional Strategies (Notes, Videos, Self discussion labs, etc)
2 Problematic student feedback
3. Student support system


I have created this structure from different sources but if Hyperledger have their own template for the course then I am flexible and would work on it

@viragumathe5 I encourage you to apply for this internship. I appreciate your enthusiasm. What you've posted here is almost exactly what I was thinking when I wrote the proposal. The term "classroom-in-a-box" means that the output from this project should be a complete course that fits into a single university term and provides lecture notes, lessons, lab experiments, quizzes and tests.

Hey folks! Is there going to be a mentorship program in 2022 ? Wondering if there are potential projects out there that I can start digging into. Please let me know. Thanks!

Hi Ayudhridhar! Mentorship 2022 is happening and details should be announced in January. As far as potential projects, you can check out the individual project chat channels here or get up to speed via the wiki (https://wiki.hyperledger.org/)  or github (https://github.com/hyperledger). We don't have Mentor Project Proposals yet, but they will have a direct connection or relevance to an existing Hyperledger project or lab
